alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 03 at 9:23AM CDT until June 06 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Horton...Minor flooding is forecast to continue. For the Marmaton River Basin...including Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast to continue. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast continue. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs at the gage site. Low lying areas along Route D near Stotesbury flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 43.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Friday was 43.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 43.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 43.8 feet on 03/21/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 930 AM CDT.
